RRT Installation

  • Ubuntu Linux
  • Mac OS X
  • Windows
  • optional git integration

To install R, the best place to start is the CRAN home page
Optionally:
Ubuntu users can

apt-get update ; apt-get install r-base

Mac Homebrew users can

brew update ; brew tap homebrew/science ; brew install R

RRT Installation by operating system

Ubuntu Linux

On Ubuntu Linux, you may need to install two system dependencies:
-XML C library
-libcurl-dev

apt-get install r-cran-xml libcurl-dev

Get dependency miniCRAN that is not on CRAN

In an R session

install.packages("devtools")
library("devtools")

install_github("andrie/miniCRAN")

Then install RRT

install_github("RevolutionAnalytics/RRT")
library("RRT")

RRT has been tested on Ubuntu 14.04.
Please create a brief item in the RRT issue tracker if you run into issues with system dependencies or general install issues.

Mac OS X

XML and curl C libraries should be installed by default on your machine. RRT has been tested on Mac OS X Mavericks.
Please create a brief item in the RRT issue tracker if you run into issues on other versions of Mac OS X and system dependencies.

Get dependency miniCRAN that is not on CRAN

In an R session

install.packages("devtools")
library("devtools")

install_github("andrie/miniCRAN")

Then install RRT

install_github("RevolutionAnalytics/RRT")
library("RRT")

Windows

  • Install Rtools
  • Install the devtools R package. You can install from source, or just install via install.packages("devtools"), or choose devtools from the R GUI.
  • Install miniCRAN
install_github("andrie/miniCRAN")
  • Then install RRT
install_github("RevolutionAnalytics/RRT")
library("RRT")

git integration

Optionally, install git2r to use git capabilities from within R / RRT. git2r is an enhancement in RRT, so you do not need git2r to install RRT. RRT users are encouraged to try the git integration features of RRT to simplify sharing R code repositories with other R users.

install_github("ropensci/git2r")
